title: Longest Common Prefix
description:
## Longest Common Prefix

You are building an autocomplete system for a search engine. When a user types characters, the system needs to find the longest shared prefix across all matching words — this prefix represents what can be safely auto-completed without ambiguity.

Given an array of strings `strs`, return the **longest common prefix** shared by all strings. If there is no common prefix, return an empty string `""`.

**Constraints:**
- `1 <= strs.length <= 200`
- `0 <= strs[i].length <= 200`
- `strs[i]` consists of only lowercase English letters.

examples.explanation: All three strings share the prefix "fl".
No common prefix among the three strings.

hiddenCases.explanation: One string is prefix of another
Empty string means no common prefix
Each is a prefix of the previous
All same character, shortest has length 1

solutions.label: Horizontal Scanning — O(S)
solutions.explanation: Start with the first string as the candidate prefix. For each subsequent string, trim the prefix from the right until it becomes a prefix of that string (or becomes empty).

solutions.label: Vertical Scanning — O(S)
solutions.explanation: Compare character by character across all strings simultaneously. For each position i, check if all strings have the same character. Stop as soon as a mismatch is found or any string is exhausted.

hints: Start with the first string as the prefix candidate and trim it as needed.
Alternatively, compare column by column — check the same character position across all strings.
